metadata.feature_description: Tests the extension point for future account settings features

steps.expected: Extensions page loads showing installed extensions
steps.actual: Extensions page loaded successfully with list of installed extensions

steps.expected: Evoq.PersonaBar.AccountSettings should appear in the list
steps.actual: Evoq.PersonaBar.AccountSettings found in Persona Bar extensions list, version 10.1.1

test_scenarios.scenario_name: Verify tabs-extensions div container exists in UI

steps.action: Attempt to access Accounts section in PersonaBar by clicking the user avatar menu item
steps.expected: Accounts panel should load with tabs-extensions div container rendered in DOM
steps.actual: The Accounts menu item exists (id='Evoq.Accounts') but does not load a content panel. The tabs-extensions div is NOT rendered in the DOM.

steps.action: Execute JavaScript to search for #tabs-extensions element in PersonaBar iframe
steps.actual: Element not found. The AccountSettings HTML template containing the div exists in code (AccountSettings.html) but is not rendered because the module has an empty 'path' in its manifest and the AccountSettingsController is empty.

issues: The tabs-extensions div container is defined in the code (AccountSettings.html line 2) but is not rendered in the UI because the AccountSettings module has no standalone navigation path and no controller implementation

test_scenarios.scenario_name: Verify personabar-extensions CSS class is applied

steps.action: Execute JavaScript to search for .personabar-extensions class in PersonaBar iframe
steps.expected: Elements with personabar-extensions class should be found
steps.actual: No elements found with personabar-extensions class. The class is defined in AccountSettings.html but the template is not rendered.

issues: The personabar-extensions CSS class is defined in code but not rendered in UI because the AccountSettings module template is not loaded

observations: Code review confirms AccountSettings.html contains:
The AccountSettingsController.cs in the Components namespace is an empty class - a placeholder for future implementation
The DNN manifest (Evoq.PersonaBar.AccountSettings.dnn) has an empty <path></path> element, meaning this module has no standalone navigation
The module appears to be designed as pure infrastructure - an extension point container for other modules to inject content into, rather than having its own visible UI
The Evoq.Accounts menu item exists in the PersonaBar (id='Evoq.Accounts', class='btn_panel useravatar') but clicking it does not load any content panel
The 'nav_Accounts' resource key appears as raw text instead of localized text, suggesting the resource file may not be properly loaded
The extension is correctly installed and registered (confirmed via Extensions page showing version 10.1.1)
This feature may require other extensions that target the tabs-extensions container to be installed for the infrastructure to be utilized
